name: Hibachi-Style Fried Rice
description: One of my favorite parts of hibachi is the fried rice and I was determined to make it at home. This recipe is quick and easy and is sure to be a big hit. I enjoy using left-over teriyaki chicken in my fried rice, but you can use any meat you want or no meat at all! With or without chicken it is equally as delicious and a great side dish! You can use more or less garlic, depending on your personal preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a wok or non-stick skillet over medium-high heat; add olive oil. Cook and stir eggs in the hot oil until cooked through, 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken, green onion, and garlic to scrambled eggs; cook and stir until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Mix rice into egg mixture; cook and stir until rice is warmed, about 2 minutes. Add soy sauce; cook and stir until rice mixture is evenly coated, about 3 minutes.

review.reviewBody: One thing I see many of these fried rice recipes missing that I've found really makes a difference is to refrigerate the cooked rice overnight before cooking.

very easy and very fast.  i cooked the rice in chicken stock for added flavor (made sure to make extra to use in other dishes).  also added a white onion to the scallion, peas, and some bok choy.  Everyone went nuts!  definitely something to make in bulk for leftovers.
Really good!  Instead of chicken I used chopped shiitake mushrooms and peas.  It was Delish and it the spot for my fried rice craving!

Wow this was delicious. I used more soy than the recipe called for and simply added as I went. Also I added frozen peas and carrots before the rice was added. I will use one egg first and then scramble the other in prior to the end. This was absolutely fantastic with extra garlic!

I made this yesterday and I would absolutely make it again.  Two things I wanted to add.  I made the rice and then put it in the freezer for about 30 minutes to cool it off.  Some of the comments for this and other fried rice recipes said to used leftover or cold rice Since I made the rice the same day I did this instead.  Also, the other comments are correct - put the soy sauce in to taste. I added peas and water chestnuts.  I think you could add whatever you like.
Absolutely delicious! I added in a leftover chicken thigh baked previously in a sweet and spicy mustard sauce.

I was skeptical about this recipe because there wasn't many ingredients required. I thought I would need more ingredients for the Hibachi taste but I was so wrong. This was very good. Both me and my boyfriend thought it tasted exactly like the restaurant hibachi chicken and rice. It was ten times better. I cooked this with frozen spring rolls from the grocery store. I almost feel like cooking this again tomorrow because I don't have leftovers. The only thing that I would change is to use soy sauce according to your own desired taste. I decided to do this and it was perfect. I think if I used what the recipe called for it would have been too much. Try it you will not be disappointed.
This is good, But it is way better when i use Jasmine Rice!, Thats the kind of rice they use at Japanese places..

I use this recipe as a base.  I always add 1 medium onion, about a cup of frozen peas, usually 2 zucchini, and a can of water chestnuts.  I start with cooking the onion for about 5 minutes on medium, then add the garlic(which I always double, we love garlic) and zucchini.  After a couple minutes, I line the pan with all the veggies that I have cooked, making room in the center to cook the eggs.  I add 1 T. of butter in the center for cooking the eggs.  That little bit of butter adds another layer of flavor to the recipe.  Once the eggs are done I add the rice, rest of the veggies, and soy sauce(4 to 6 Tablespoons).  Before serving I also add salt and pepper to taste and about 1 teaspoon of sesame oil to it all and mix well.  My son doesn't like the texture of sesame seeds.  The sesame oil gives the taste of the seeds without the texture of them.  Every time I make this everyone raves about how it's better than take out and just as good if not better than the hibachi restaurant.  I hope this helps others.  When it comes to cooking recipes, I love experimenting!  BTW, I cooked the chicken separate.  My son is autistic.  I've learned to cook certain ways so he will eat everything.  And chicken on the side and not mixed in is another thing that helps him.  Enjoy!!
No idea what went wrong...it was one giant congealed lump. It smelled good and tasted okay but I think I m eating pizza now...
